intro: Draba lanciformis, commonly known as the lancolate whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Draba lanciformis is known for its low-growing habit and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
